TopicTitle: Juno engine as gas turbine generator?

Articles.Content:
Just a quick question thrown out of curiosity. Given the locations with in-take air is available it would be of limited use.

However, the juno engine is very efficient in burning fuel. Any more thoughts?
You'd want to compare the EC/LF to the fuel cell array; if it didn't compare favorably, I think it should probably be treated as a bug.

That is something I had considered as well.  It would be great for a kerosene-powered electric motor car to roll around Kerbin in where it would also double as a down-force generator to give it better traction and handling.

Doing the calculations I found the juno expends 0.064 liquid fuel per unit of electricity, even less than the basic jet, while the fuel cell only uses 0.00249 units of liquid fuel and oxidizer.

In short, no.

Edited March 21, 2016 by nosirrbro
